title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in data set editor page of the query tab
description: On the data set editor page of the query tab, when changing the data source for a data set that does not have an SQL statement, the children node listing is not displayed. Closing the data set editor and reopening it does not resolve the issue.
OB: No children node listing is displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
EB: The children node listing should be displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab.
SR:
1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 
2. Open the data set editor and navigate to the data source page. 
3. Change the data source. 
4. Check that the new data source has no database, table, or column information. 
5. Observe that there is no children node listing. 
6. Close the data set editor and reopen it. 
7. Repeat steps 2-5. 
8. Verify that the children node listing is still not displayed.
